Browse the source code of netbsd/external/bsd/libpcap/dist/savefile.c

9 * retain the above copyright notice and this paragraph in its entirety, (2)
10 * distributions including binary code include the above copyright notice and
11 * this paragraph in its entirety in the documentation or other materials
12 * provided with the distribution, and (3) all advertising materials mentioning
13 * features or use of this software display the following acknowledgement:
14 * ``This product includes software developed by the University of California,
15 * Lawrence Berkeley Laboratory and its contributors.'' Neither the name of
16 * the University nor the names of its contributors may be used to endorse
17 * or promote products derived from this software without specific prior
18 * written permission.
19 * THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED ``AS IS'' AND WITHOUT ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED
20 * WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
21 * MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
22 *
23 * savefile.c - supports offline use of tcpdump
24 * Extraction/creation by Jeffrey Mogul, DECWRL
25 * Modified by Steve McCanne, LBL.
26 *
27 * Used to save the received packet headers, after filtering, to
28 * a file, and then read them later.
29 * The first record in the file contains saved values for the machine
30 * dependent values so we can print the dump file on any architecture.
31 */
32
33#include <sys/cdefs.h>
34__RCSID("$NetBSD: savefile.c,v 1.5 2018/09/03 15:26:43 christos Exp $");

61#ifdef _WIN32
62/*
63 * These aren't exported on Windows, because they would only work if both
64 * WinPcap and the code using it were to use the Universal CRT; otherwise,
65 * a FILE structure in WinPcap and a FILE structure in the code using it
66 * could be different if they're using different versions of the C runtime.
67 *
68 * Instead, pcap/pcap.h defines them as macros that wrap the hopen versions,
69 * with the wrappers calling _fileno() and _get_osfhandle() themselves,
70 * so that they convert the appropriate CRT version's FILE structure to
71 * a HANDLE (which is OS-defined, not CRT-defined, and is part of the Win32
72 * and Win64 ABIs).
73 */
74static pcap_t *pcap_fopen_offline_with_tstamp_precision(FILE *, u_int, char *);
75static pcap_t *pcap_fopen_offline(FILE *, char *);
76#endif
77
78/*
79 * Setting O_BINARY on DOS/Windows is a bit tricky
80 */
81#if defined(_WIN32)
82 #define SET_BINMODE(f) _setmode(_fileno(f), _O_BINARY)
83#elif defined(MSDOS)
84 #if defined(__HIGHC__)
85 #define SET_BINMODE(f) setmode(f, O_BINARY)
86 #else
87 #define SET_BINMODE(f) setmode(fileno(f), O_BINARY)
88 #endif
89#endif
90
91static int
92sf_getnonblock(pcap_t *p _U_)
93{
94 /*
95 * This is a savefile, not a live capture file, so never say
96 * it's in non-blocking mode.
97 */
98 return (0);
99}
100
101static int
102sf_setnonblock(pcap_t *p, int nonblock _U_)
103{
104 /*
105 * This is a savefile, not a live capture file, so reject
106 * requests to put it in non-blocking mode. (If it's a
107 * pipe, it could be put in non-blocking mode, but that
108 * would significantly complicate the code to read packets,
109 * as it would have to handle reading partial packets and
110 * keeping the state of the read.)
111 */
112 pcap_snprintf(p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
113 "Savefiles cannot be put into non-blocking mode");
114 return (-1);
115}
116
117static int
118sf_stats(pcap_t *p, struct pcap_stat *ps _U_)
119{
120 pcap_snprintf(p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
121 "Statistics aren't available from savefiles");
122 return (-1);
123}
124
125#ifdef _WIN32
126static struct pcap_stat *
127sf_stats_ex(pcap_t *p, int *size)
128{
129 pcap_snprintf(p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
130 "Statistics aren't available from savefiles");
131 return (NULL);
132}
133
134static int
135sf_setbuff(pcap_t *p, int dim)
136{
137 pcap_snprintf(p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
138 "The kernel buffer size cannot be set while reading from a file");
139 return (-1);
140}
141
142static int
143sf_setmode(pcap_t *p, int mode)
144{
145 pcap_snprintf(p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
146 "impossible to set mode while reading from a file");
147 return (-1);
148}
149
150static int
151sf_setmintocopy(pcap_t *p, int size)
152{
153 pcap_snprintf(p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
154 "The mintocopy parameter cannot be set while reading from a file");
155 return (-1);
156}
157
158static HANDLE
159sf_getevent(pcap_t *pcap)
160{
161 (void)pcap_snprintf(pcap->errbuf, sizeof(pcap->errbuf),
162 "The read event cannot be retrieved while reading from a file");
163 return (INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE);
164}
165
166static int
167sf_oid_get_request(pcap_t *p, bpf_u_int32 oid _U_, void *data _U_,
168 size_t *lenp _U_)
169{
170 pcap_snprintf(p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
171 "An OID get request cannot be performed on a file");
172 return (PCAP_ERROR);
173}
174
175static int
176sf_oid_set_request(pcap_t *p, bpf_u_int32 oid _U_, const void *data _U_,
177 size_t *lenp _U_)
178{
179 pcap_snprintf(p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
180 "An OID set request cannot be performed on a file");
181 return (PCAP_ERROR);
182}
183
184static u_int
185sf_sendqueue_transmit(pcap_t *p, pcap_send_queue *queue, int sync)
186{
187 strlcpy(p->errbuf, "Sending packets isn't supported on savefiles",
188 PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE);
189 return (0);
190}
191
192static int
193sf_setuserbuffer(pcap_t *p, int size)
194{
195 pcap_snprintf(p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
196 "The user buffer cannot be set when reading from a file");
197 return (-1);
198}

200static int
201sf_live_dump(pcap_t *p, char *filename, int maxsize, int maxpacks)
202{
203 pcap_snprintf(p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
204 "Live packet dumping cannot be performed when reading from a file");
205 return (-1);
206}
207
208static int
209sf_live_dump_ended(pcap_t *p, int sync)
210{
211 pcap_snprintf(p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
212 "Live packet dumping cannot be performed on a pcap_open_dead pcap_t");
213 return (-1);
214}

216static PAirpcapHandle
217sf_get_airpcap_handle(pcap_t *pcap)
218{
219 return (NULL);
220}
221#endif
222
223static int
224sf_inject(pcap_t *p, const void *buf _U_, size_t size _U_)
225{
226 strlcpy(p->errbuf, "Sending packets isn't supported on savefiles",
227 PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE);
228 return (-1);
229}

231/*
232 * Set direction flag: Which packets do we accept on a forwarding
233 * single device? IN, OUT or both?
234 */
235static int
236sf_setdirection(pcap_t *p, pcap_direction_t d _U_)
237{
238 pcap_snprintf(p->errbuf, sizeof(p->errbuf),
239 "Setting direction is not supported on savefiles");
240 return (-1);
241}
242
243void
244sf_cleanup(pcap_t *p)
245{
246 if (p->rfile != stdin)
247 (void)fclose(p->rfile);
248 if (p->buffer != NULL)
249 free(p->buffer);
250 pcap_freecode(&p->fcode);
251}
252
253pcap_t *
254pcap_open_offline_with_tstamp_precision(const char *fname, u_int precision,
255 char *errbuf)
256{
257 FILE *fp;
258 pcap_t *p;
259
260 if (fname == NULL) {
261 pcap_snprintf(errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
262 "A null pointer was supplied as the file name");
263 return (NULL);
264 }
265 if (fname[0] == '-' && fname[1] == '\0')
266 {
267 fp = stdin;
268#if defined(_WIN32) || defined(MSDOS)
269 /*
270 * We're reading from the standard input, so put it in binary
271 * mode, as savefiles are binary files.
272 */
273 SET_BINMODE(fp);
274#endif
275 }
276 else {
277 /*
278 * "b" is supported as of C90, so *all* UN*Xes should
279 * support it, even though it does nothing. It's
280 * required on Windows, as the file is a binary file
281 * and must be read in binary mode.
282 */
283 fp = fopen(fname, "rb");
284 if (fp == NULL) {
285 pcap_fmt_errmsg_for_errno(errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
286 errno, "%s", fname);
287 return (NULL);
288 }
289 }
290 p = pcap_fopen_offline_with_tstamp_precision(fp, precision, errbuf);
291 if (p == NULL) {
292 if (fp != stdin)
293 fclose(fp);
294 }
295 return (p);
296}
297
298pcap_t *
299pcap_open_offline(const char *fname, char *errbuf)
300{
301 return (pcap_open_offline_with_tstamp_precision(fname,
302 PCAP_TSTAMP_PRECISION_MICRO, errbuf));
303}
304
305#ifdef _WIN32
306pcap_t* pcap_hopen_offline_with_tstamp_precision(intptr_t osfd, u_int precision,
307 char *errbuf)
308{
309 int fd;
310 FILE *file;
311
312 fd = _open_osfhandle(osfd, _O_RDONLY);
313 if ( fd < 0 )
314 {
315 pcap_fmt_errmsg_for_errno(errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
316 errno, "_open_osfhandle");
317 return NULL;
318 }
319
320 file = _fdopen(fd, "rb");
321 if ( file == NULL )
322 {
323 pcap_fmt_errmsg_for_errno(errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
324 errno, "_fdopen");
325 return NULL;
326 }
327
328 return pcap_fopen_offline_with_tstamp_precision(file, precision,
329 errbuf);
330}
331
332pcap_t* pcap_hopen_offline(intptr_t osfd, char *errbuf)
333{
334 return pcap_hopen_offline_with_tstamp_precision(osfd,
335 PCAP_TSTAMP_PRECISION_MICRO, errbuf);
336}
337#endif
338
339static pcap_t *(*check_headers[])(bpf_u_int32, FILE *, u_int, char *, int *) = {
340 pcap_check_header,
341 pcap_ng_check_header
342};
343
344#define N_FILE_TYPES (sizeof check_headers / sizeof check_headers[0])
345
346#ifdef _WIN32
347static
348#endif
349pcap_t *
350pcap_fopen_offline_with_tstamp_precision(FILE *fp, u_int precision,
351 char *errbuf)
352{
353 register pcap_t *p;
354 bpf_u_int32 magic;
355 size_t amt_read;
356 u_int i;
357 int err;
358
359 /*
360 * Read the first 4 bytes of the file; the network analyzer dump
361 * file formats we support (pcap and pcapng), and several other
362 * formats we might support in the future (such as snoop, DOS and
363 * Windows Sniffer, and Microsoft Network Monitor) all have magic
364 * numbers that are unique in their first 4 bytes.
365 */
366 amt_read = fread((char *)&magic, 1, sizeof(magic), fp);
367 if (amt_read != sizeof(magic)) {
368 if (ferror(fp)) {
369 pcap_fmt_errmsg_for_errno(errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
370 errno, "error reading dump file");
371 } else {
372 pcap_snprintf(errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
373 "truncated dump file; tried to read %lu file header bytes, only got %lu",
374 (unsigned long)sizeof(magic),
375 (unsigned long)amt_read);
376 }
377 return (NULL);
378 }
379
380 /*
381 * Try all file types.
382 */
383 for (i = 0; i < N_FILE_TYPES; i++) {
384 p = (*check_headers[i])(magic, fp, precision, errbuf, &err);
385 if (p != NULL) {
386 /* Yup, that's it. */
387 goto found;
388 }
389 if (err) {
390 /*
391 * Error trying to read the header.
392 */
393 return (NULL);
394 }
395 }
396
397 /*
398 * Well, who knows what this mess is....
399 */
400 pcap_snprintf(errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE, "unknown file format");
401 return (NULL);
402
403found:
404 p->rfile = fp;
405
406 /* Padding only needed for live capture fcode */
407 p->fddipad = 0;
408
409#if !defined(_WIN32) && !defined(MSDOS)
410 /*
411 * You can do "select()" and "poll()" on plain files on most
412 * platforms, and should be able to do so on pipes.
413 *
414 * You can't do "select()" on anything other than sockets in
415 * Windows, so, on Win32 systems, we don't have "selectable_fd".
416 */
417 p->selectable_fd = fileno(fp);
418#endif
419
420 p->read_op = pcap_offline_read;
421 p->inject_op = sf_inject;
422 p->setfilter_op = install_bpf_program;
423 p->setdirection_op = sf_setdirection;
424 p->set_datalink_op = NULL; /* we don't support munging link-layer headers */
425 p->getnonblock_op = sf_getnonblock;
426 p->setnonblock_op = sf_setnonblock;
427 p->stats_op = sf_stats;
428#ifdef _WIN32
429 p->stats_ex_op = sf_stats_ex;
430 p->setbuff_op = sf_setbuff;
431 p->setmode_op = sf_setmode;
432 p->setmintocopy_op = sf_setmintocopy;
433 p->getevent_op = sf_getevent;
434 p->oid_get_request_op = sf_oid_get_request;
435 p->oid_set_request_op = sf_oid_set_request;
436 p->sendqueue_transmit_op = sf_sendqueue_transmit;
437 p->setuserbuffer_op = sf_setuserbuffer;
438 p->live_dump_op = sf_live_dump;
439 p->live_dump_ended_op = sf_live_dump_ended;
440 p->get_airpcap_handle_op = sf_get_airpcap_handle;
441#endif
442
443 /*
444 * For offline captures, the standard one-shot callback can
445 * be used for pcap_next()/pcap_next_ex().
446 */
447 p->oneshot_callback = pcap_oneshot;
448
449 /*
450 * Savefiles never require special BPF code generation.
451 */
452 p->bpf_codegen_flags = 0;
453
454 p->activated = 1;
455
456 return (p);
457}
458
459#ifdef _WIN32
460static
461#endif
462pcap_t *
463pcap_fopen_offline(FILE *fp, char *errbuf)
464{
465 return (pcap_fopen_offline_with_tstamp_precision(fp,
466 PCAP_TSTAMP_PRECISION_MICRO, errbuf));
467}
468
469/*
470 * Read packets from a capture file, and call the callback for each
471 * packet.
472 * If cnt > 0, return after 'cnt' packets, otherwise continue until eof.
473 */
474int
475pcap_offline_read(pcap_t *p, int cnt, pcap_handler callback, u_char *user)
476{
477 struct bpf_insn *fcode;
478 int status = 0;
479 int n = 0;
480 u_char *data;
481
482 while (status == 0) {
483 struct pcap_pkthdr h;
484
485 /*
486 * Has "pcap_breakloop()" been called?
487 * If so, return immediately - if we haven't read any
488 * packets, clear the flag and return -2 to indicate
489 * that we were told to break out of the loop, otherwise
490 * leave the flag set, so that the *next* call will break
491 * out of the loop without having read any packets, and
492 * return the number of packets we've processed so far.
493 */
494 if (p->break_loop) {
495 if (n == 0) {
496 p->break_loop = 0;
497 return (-2);
498 } else
499 return (n);
500 }
501
502 status = p->next_packet_op(p, &h, &data);
503 if (status) {
504 if (status == 1)
505 return (0);
506 return (status);
507 }
508
509 if ((fcode = p->fcode.bf_insns) == NULL ||
510 bpf_filter(fcode, data, h.len, h.caplen)) {
511 (*callback)(user, &h, data);
512 if (++n >= cnt && cnt > 0)
513 break;
514 }
515 }
516 /*XXX this breaks semantics tcpslice expects */
517 return (n);
518}
